seasonal_context.typical_patterns: Active North Pacific storm track, large NW-W swells common

buoy_analysis.narrative: Major NW swell event underway. Buoy 51001 recording 18-20ft @ 18s from 305° (NW), peaking since 03:00 HST. Buoy 51201 shows 22-25ft faces @ 17s from 310° - largest reading in 3 months. Spectral analysis shows dominant long-period energy with secondary W swell component (12ft @ 14s from 270°). Cross-buoy timing indicates dual swell systems: primary NW groundswell and trailing W swell. High confidence in extreme surf conditions North and West shores.

pressure_analysis.narrative: Historic North Pacific storm complex. Primary low (952 mb) at 48°N, 170°W on Dec 5-6 generated 1000+ nm NW fetch with sustained 60 kt winds. Secondary low (958 mb) at 45°N, 165°W on Dec 6-7 added overlapping W fetch. Wave period charts show exceptional 18-20s energy arriving Dec 8-9, with secondary 14-16s W component. High pressure ridge south providing strong offshore flow. Pattern resembles historic Eddie Aikau contest swells. Very high confidence in XXL surf event.

key_findings: Historic multi-swell event with XXL North Shore surf
Primary NW swell 18-22ft @ 18s, secondary W swell 12-14ft @ 15s
Buoy readings confirm extreme conditions already arrived
Offshore winds creating excellent but dangerous conditions
Likely Eddie Aikau contest-caliber swell (30-40ft+ faces North Shore)
High surf warning conditions - life-threatening surf expected

north.warning: Life-threatening surf. Expert watermen only. Likely beach closures.
